elements.title: Joseph (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Théodore Géricault's paintings of Haitian-born model Joseph (example pictured) are unusual in portraying him as "an actual, distinct person"?

elements.title: a Kansas TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Kansas TV station claimed it had "The Look of a Leader" and then went on to become the leader in its market?

elements.title: Wanda Szuman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Wanda Szuman, a pioneer of special education in Poland, was also active in underground education?

elements.title: Cassette Beasts (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one reviewer said that her favorite part of Cassette Beasts was that it is not "forced to cater to younger children", unlike Pokémon?

elements.title: Wihtburh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the incorruptibility of Wihtburh's body was considered a miracle?

elements.title: declarative knowledge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that declarative knowledge is an awareness of facts that differs from practical knowledge in the form of skills and knowledge by acquaintance based on experiential familiarity?

elements.title: Christopher W. Shaw (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Christopher W. Shaw has called for the return of banking at the United States Postal Service?

elements.title: Neptune in fiction (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that English-speaking elephants can be okay on Neptune in fiction, but a solid surface is not?
